"i do not fear to die," she said; "that pang is past. god raises my weakness, and gives me courage to endure the worst. i leave a sad and bitter world; and if you remember me, and think of me as of one unjustly condemned, i am resigned to the fate awaiting me. learn from me, dear lady, to submit in patience to the will of heaven!"']
rdgGrp.rdg: <longToken>Justine shook her head mournfully. “I do not fear to die,” she said; “that pang is past. God raises my weakness, and gives me courage to endure the worst. I leave a sad and bitter world; and if you remember me, and think of me as of one unjustly condemned, I am resigned to the fate awaiting me. Learn from me, dear lady, to submit in patience to the will of Heaven!”</longToken>

rdgGrp.n: ['and on the morrow justine died. elizabeth’s heart-rending eloquence failed to move the judges from their settled conviction in the criminality of the saintly sufferer. my passionate and indignant appeals were lost upon them. and when i received their cold answers, and heard the harsh unfeeling reasoning of these men, my purposed avowal died away on my lips. thus i might proclaim myself a madman, but not revoke the sentence passed upon my wretched victim. she perished on the scaffold as a murderess!']
rdgGrp.rdg: <longToken>And on the morrow Justine died. Elizabeth’s heart-rending eloquence failed to move the judges from their settled conviction in the criminality of the saintly sufferer. My passionate and indignant appeals were lost upon them. And when I received their cold answers, and heard the harsh unfeeling reasoning of these men, my purposed avowal died away on my lips. Thus I might proclaim myself a madman, but not revoke the sentence passed upon my wretched victim. She perished on the scaffold as a murderess!</longToken>

rdgGrp.n: ['from the tortures of my own heart, i turned to contemplate the deep and voiceless grief of my elizabeth. this also was my doing! and my father’s woe, and the desolation of that late so smiling home—all was the work of my thrice-accursed hands! ye weep, unhappy ones; but these are not your last tears! again shall you raise']
rdgGrp.rdg: <longToken>From the tortures of my own heart, I turned to contemplate the deep and voiceless grief of my Elizabeth. This also was my doing! And my father’s woe, and the desolation of that late so smiling home—all was the work of my thrice-accursed hands! Ye weep, unhappy ones; but these are not your last tears! Again shall you raise</longToken>

rdgGrp.n: ['the funeral wail, and the sound of your lamentations shall again and again be heard! frankenstein, your son, your kinsman, your early, much-loved friend; he who would spend each vital drop of blood for your sakes—who has no thought nor sense of joy, except as it is mirrored also in your dear countenances—who would fill the air with blessings, and spend his life in serving you—he bids you weep—to shed countless tears; happy beyond his hopes, if thus inexorable fate be satisfied, and if the destruction pause before the peace of the grave have succeeded to your sad torments!']
rdgGrp.rdg: <longToken>the funeral wail, and the sound of your lamentations shall again and again be heard! Frankenstein, your son, your kinsman, your early, much-loved friend; he who would spend each vital drop of blood for your sakes—who has no thought nor sense of joy, except as it is mirrored also in your dear countenances—who would fill the air with blessings, and spend his life in serving you—he bids you weep—to shed countless tears; happy beyond his hopes, if thus inexorable fate be satisfied, and if the destruction pause before the peace of the grave have succeeded to your sad torments!</longToken>

rdgGrp.n: ['<p-start/>', 'thus spoke my prophetic soul, as, torn by remorse, horror, and despair, i beheld those i loved spend vain sorrow upon the graves of william and justine, the first hapless victims to my unhallowed arts.', '<p-end/>']
rdgGrp.rdg: Thus spoke my prophetic soul, as, torn by remorse, horror, and despair, I beheld those I loved spend vain sorrow upon the graves of William and Justine, the first hapless victims to my unhallowed arts.
